title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse manager and asked basic questions about myself. Then got a tour of the unit. Process took about 3 weeks and got a call from HR with an offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient is upset

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and very apt Healthcare oriented Punctual and accountable Pt centered facility. Followed covid guidelines I had a pleasant experience during the interview. Everyone is collegial and informative. Didn’t get any negative vibes
Interview Questions: Future goals in next 5 years

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Asked a few questions about background, experience and what I like to do outside of work. Interviewer was super nice, answered all my questions adequately. Offered me to shadow before accepting a position
Interview Questions: Why did you choose DMC?

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a 10question intense interview the interviewer was very nice and knowledgeable I feel like they asked all the right questions and when I asked questions she gave very precise answers
Interview Questions: What are your three best qualities and three that needs improvement

title: PSA Patient Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Attended a Hiring Event, they seemed to be all over the place. Was there from the beginning to the end and only was able to interview with one hospital. Other people there were going from one interview to the next. Over looking the people who had been waiting for quite some time.
Interview Questions: What experience I had pertaining to the job.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview by hiring manager and HR manager final virtual panel interview by 5 senior leaders. Took about 2 weeks. Seemed responsive throughout. Salary offered was less than expected but team seemed great.
Interview Questions: How do you resolve conflicts?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: 3 Virtual interview. 15 minutes each one with the PD, APD and the Chief resident. Classic questions. Good atmosphere. very nice and thorough presentation in the morning and interviews were in the afternoon. Social hours with resident was nice, reflected w great atmosphere and supportive residents.
Interview Questions: what is good about you ?

title: Llmsw Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Two interview process,formal, relaxed interview not as detailed as one would expect . However the position was very face pace working in the Emergency Room. You will learn a lot and gain a host of new skills, colleague  that can help you along the way .
Interview Questions: Turn over rate, staff to patient ratio

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Straight forward, math test first, must pass otherwise interview is over, and then basic interview questions and previous experiences with management followed by a tour of the pharmacy.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths and weaknesses?

title: RN High Risk Antepartum Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with the nursing supervisor who is super nice. Didn’t hear back for a couple weeks but she did call to check in as well.  Overall the wait after applying was long but understandable.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing this unit?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: People were friendly and they all seemed pleased with being there and their support staff, but administration turned me off with their old school attitudes in terms of the expectations of their employees.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to move to Detroit?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview for me.  I directly got matched based on the application I submitted. I uploaded my resume to the website. I uploaded my transcripts and extracurriculars and letters of recommendations.
Interview Questions: None just through filling out the application and uploading my resume.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions very nice staff and did shadowing after to show you around the unit and see if you like the environment. The unit was nice and looked clean and the interview questions were straightforward
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and was reached out by staff for an interview the next week. 2 interviewers with one interviewee, an MD and NP. Straight forward questions. More of a conversation than interview. Had a 45 minute conversation. Interviewers suggested coming in to shadow and experience the clinic to see if its compatible. Will discuss offer after shadowing day.
Interview Questions:
What are you strengths and weaknesses?
Why did you choose us? 
What salary do you want?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward and comfortable. Did require a math test to pass, that was the first part of the interview. If passed, would move on to interview questions with management. Interview questions were standard interview questions with a tour at the end.
Interview Questions: What would you say is your weakness?

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: My interview went great! The manager spent time getting to know me. She/he was late but it’s ok. I didn’t hear for three months after I applied. I received a phone call to set up  the interview. The interview itself was quick. And i heard back a week later
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: asked what strengths and weaknesses are and a few questions about past experience. very nice and not intimidating. easy interview questions overall. got the job at the end . just make sure you know why you want the job as well.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Billing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very easy.  Applied online received call in less than two weeks. Was told at the interview they would like to move forward with me. I should be expecting a phone call from a recruiter within the next week to make an offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your billing experience. How long have you been doing medical billing?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: standard interview process for a resident. They select wide variety of candidates for interview from various ethnicities. Diverse people working there. The patient load is a lot. Has all specialties for fellowship.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, nothing unusual. Want to get the job? FOLLOW UP. Try to get a managers contact info or something and give them a call. Almost every (not nurses) person who has been hired in our department did it.
Interview Questions: Everything was run of the mill.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was called to schedule an interview after applying online at DMC careers website.  I came in to the unit floor and was introduced to the staff. I was then interviewed and after given a brief tour of the unit. I was interviewed by the day and night shift clinical managers. I was given information on the unit and given a brief explanation of duties on the unit and the kind of patient that are seen. I was then told I was going to get called within the next couple of days. Over all the entire interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your self in three words?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: HR called about 4 days before the interview to set it up. The whole interview was very laid back and brief. Interviewers made you feel relaxed, and were happy to answer any questions you have.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about yourself.
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
How would coworkers and peers describe you?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Received a very odd voicemail from HR to call back and schedule an interview. I called back 2 hours later and left a message. The next day, HR never called me. I left another voicemail, stating I'm very interested in the 3 open positions.  HR never returned my call.  I expected better from DMC, very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Please call us back and schedule an interview.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Arrived for scheduled interview. It took less than 30 minutes, with only a few formal questions asked. I was only given the opportunity to ask one question. Not a very indepth interview.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time when you had a patient who was upset with their care and what you personally did to resolve the problem/situation.

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Just like any other interview pretty much. You need to be eager to learn and seem interested in the job. Also, have a good helpful attitude and mention that you love being part of a team.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was with the manager and two physicians. It was a good interview.  Everybody loved my personality. I would have got the job but it is a long story.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what your manager would say about you.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had a twenty minute phone interview asking why I would be a good fit for this job. What past experience or strengths do I possess would help me most in this position.
Interview Questions: Have I ever been involved in a restructuring plan?

title: Telemetry Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, nice person with a great attitude. Friendly and tried hard to make me feel comfortable. He showed me around the unit and explained to me what the job consisted of and where I woukd be stationed if I took the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years? Name a time when you dealt with a stressful situations and how you handles it. If a patient or their family got angry and in your face what would you do? Do you have a telemetry certification? How many times were you absent at your last job? If the shift got busy would you stay after it ended if need be?

title: MLS Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions:
Was quick and easy. basic interview questions. 
some interpersonal questions
did a lab tour that was fairly quick. 
I had a great experiance and actually enjoyed the interview.
no technical questions.
I have not heard back yet on an offor.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself and your family

title: Patient Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: applied online  got a call a week later. I was told when my in person interview was going to take place. Made it to the interview the interview lasted 10-15 minutes repeated questions on your attuide with different situations with patients. after that i was told to sit back and wait to get another call if chosen. waited another week was called offered the job. The recuriter told  when orientation was then a day be fore orientation it got cancelled and push up anothr two weeks.
Interview Questions: How do would you handle a patient that's combative and confused?

title: Diet Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Q&A. I was called in for an initial interview, and completed the interview in person. A hiring manager interviewed me alone, and called me in a couple weeks to give a job offer.
Interview Questions: Name a time when something went wrong. What did you do to resolve the issue?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from one of the managers asking could I come in for a interview? She gave me the job description over the phone and scheduled a interview from there. 2 managers were in the room
Interview Questions: Have you ever collect a POS?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Upon arrival to the facility I was directed upstairs and met with the nurse manager. All of my questions were answered and the environment was very inviting. I would be honored to work with this company.
Interview Questions: How did you respond to or deal with a patient whom you upset?

title: Telemetry Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Ordinary questions. Before you leave the interview make sure to get someone's number. That got me the job. Follow up on the interview, call back.  Very simple interview, long process.
Interview Questions: If you are generall good at interviews you will do just fine. Interview questions are ordinary like what did you do in stressful situations, things like that.

title: Telemetry Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: straight and to the point. the manager interviewing me was really nice and basically told me that I had the job. It was a really relaxed environment overall. This was a one on one interview that took place very early in the morning.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for DMC?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was more than easy. It was a casual environment that was comfortable. There were just two managers who asked basic questions. They left a lot of time for me to ask questions as they respectfully answered them to the best of their ability.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at the DMC?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was nice except the male director who I found unprofessional. He even asked me illegal questions prefacing the fact that they were illegal. "I'm not supposed to ask you this, but..." It made me really uncomfortable because what does that say about the culture of the lab? What else are they not supposed to do but do anyway? I was relieved when it was over because it felt more like an interrogation than an interview. I'd rather be unemployed than work at a place like that.
Interview Questions: "I'm not supposed to ask you this, but..."

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very friendly and to the point. Great experience. Called back within one week. Hiring manager was very patient, honest and straightforward. Great people skills and polite. Very open to getting feed back from the interview. Had a offer within 1 week.
Interview Questions: How was my experience with a difficulty customer? How did I handle that situation?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Recruiting officer calls to schedule interviews interview, then recruiter calls with officer. You then go for physical and drug test. They draw blood for MMR and will give flu shot for free if you haven't received one
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I've applied several times over 3 months. Finally received a call for an interview. Interview for full time days at DMC Harper. The interview was between the manager and educator. A lot of clinical questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: D.m.c ) was awesome  I meet with a lady name Deborah gurdy who directed me to the HR or the person who was interviewing me and it was very quick simple and Common Sense questions. one of the questions I kind of stuttered on but I regain my control and I believe I got it. Lol
Interview Questions: Have I almost made a mistake and told a patient personal information/business  befor?

title: RESPIRATORY TECH Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process was positive. They didn't ask much about my experience. They wanted to know if I knew general anatomy question. The overall experience was positive. I excepted the offer. I've been with the company for 4 years.
Interview Questions: What is a normal ph

title: Patient Safety Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very simple the management don't really ask you to make questions as long as you have the proper documents/ high school diploma or equivalent. I they called you for a interview you basically have the job.
Interview Questions: Do you meet all of the qualifications and have the certifications for the position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I went in for two in person interviews with the manager and spent a few hours "shadowing" a nurse on staff. It was overkill and by the end I really didn't care if I was offered the position, as it gave me some insight as to the high turnover.
Interview Questions: Tell me how you would respond to an unhappy patient.

title: Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 4 different people OR manager, Coordinator, scheduler, and CPD coordinator, wasn't too bad but I felt that the OR coordinator didn't like me. Still got an offer but may go back to nursing school in a couple years due to the low pay surgical technicians receive since RN's literally make twice as much as the techs in the OR. Interview was pretty relaxed and focused on behavioral type interview questions.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Interview type questions

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Friendly manager, easy going, asked questions about previous job history and what you can bring to the company. They ask why you are the best person for the job. Interview lasted about 1 hour.
Interview Questions: What is your best quality?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very forth going very easy to talk to the interviewers the questions were understandable and the staff was friendly  the interview started on time I was even giving a tour of the lab should I be hired
Interview Questions:
how do you deal with hard situations ?
what makes you a better candidate then the others 
how many time have you called in or been absent or tardy

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with people from different parts of the department. Each individual read from a list of basic and prepared  questions. The interview process was fairly quick, only had one interview and was offered the position about a month later. Had to complete physical, background and drug test before starting the job.
Interview Questions: Most difficult thing about your current position or place of employement?

title: HIM Processor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I put in an application in the beginning of May and didn't get a call for an interview until mid-July. I received my offer a week later and started working two weeks after the initial phone call.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult task you had to encounter at work.

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Meeting with the Hiring Manager for brief idea and then meeting with 2 other people for a detailed interview and learning more about the place and also getting to know me.

It was an average interview where you can feel welcomed and being professional at the same time. They were so friendly and able to make you very comfortable and gives you the opportunity to express yourself.
Interview Questions: Discussing skills, why want to work at DMC, How did you hear about the position, Describe yourself,.....

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: After completing an application, applicants are called in for an interview and meet with three interviewers. They are asked questions and their answers are written down. Those applicants best suited to the job are called back.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to handle a rather difficult customer or co-worker.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: HR department was very helpful during orientation process. They provided me with a peace a of mind to help represent myself best.Well experience to start work at such a wonderful place.
Interview Questions: Do you have work visa/green card to work here?

title: Health Information Management Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Myrtle Beach, SC) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews with human resources. Followed by 1 interview with the direct Regional and then a team interview with both Regionals. I then flew to Myrtle Beach, SC and had an onsite interview. This interview was broken down to separate interviews with the Regional, CFO and then a panel of my peers.
Interview Questions: At this time the day is a blur. From my 5am flight out to my return flight and flight the same day. An odd question that I have not been asked before was "what type of animal do I relate to?"

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Recommended for this position through an internal hire. Interview was pretty easy and they were eager to hire right away. Unfortunately, there had been constant turnover in this position, so there were initial concerns with hiring. All of my questions were answered.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted a minimum of 45 minutes and I had the skills and ability for the position. I was asked how much experience I had in drawing children as well as Geriatric patients
Interview Questions: What is my best quality

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Was well done ..was comfortable and relaxed.  She made me feel I was already part of the team and made me understand that their was room to grow in the company due to my experience in the medical field.
Interview Questions: How well do I work with others?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Once notified, the interview was sheduled seven days later. I applied for the position of Lab Assistant, the requirements posted for this were consistant with that of someone who would be responsible for processing lab specimen but at the interview they were clear that they only wanted someone to as a clerk to file paper work.
Interview Questions: What one event was responsible for changing my life? How did it affect me?

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very easy : they need you so if your not completely incompetent then you have the job. One on one interviews and just want to make sure you can preform the very minimums. One time interviews not staged no approval need department manager makes the decision
Interview Questions: Basic senario questions to make sure you at least possess basic skills

title: Processing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: terrible and unorganized. it remains obvious that the management staff couldn't answer what was their training process and how long does it take an average employee to advance within the company it was immediately understood how unprofessional this staff was.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in five years

title: Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Several question on experience. Behavioral questions on values, ethics and goals. The manager gave me the job on the spot. The new employee orientation process took one day. HR dept. was great and walked us through all the benefits choices.
Interview Questions: How would you add value to dept.

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: There was no phone screen. There was only an initial call to schedule the interview. To my surprise, I was met with a panel interview of three interviewers. There was no continuity to the interview. I was under the impression the interviewers did not meet before hand to discuss how to divide the questions. I was told there was a two-step process. I was called back for part two. Part two was actually split into two parts! The first part consisted of meeting wtih five hospital staff. The second part, which required another visit, consisted of meeting with five more hospital staff. From a candidate perspective, meeting 13 people for a non-management position seemed like overkill. My friend interviewed two months later and the recruiting process was completely revamped. She met with less than half of the interviewers. Ultimately, she was extended an offer. Initially, I was disappointed because DMC was one of my targeted companies. Now that the process has been revamped, it's possible I may be interested again.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience in working with various levels of the organization.

title: Director Revenue Cyle Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring and interview process took a total of 4 months from initial submission of cv to job offer. 3 separate phone interviews ranging from HR Generalist, to Peers within DMC, Physician leadership team.
43 on-site interviews. First was with who would be my management team. Second round was interview with Operations/IT Manager and Director of Coding. Third round was with my eventual boss and fourth was with the CEO of the Medical Group

total hours spent in entire process roughly 11-15 hours..
Interview Questions:
What challenges I would face transitioning back to a Director Revenue Cycle role with 6 direct reports, operational staff of 18 and the question if I could reintegrate into this role after serving as an Operational Manager without any direct reports for the previous four years.  This line of questioning was unexpected because I had over 15 years of Director Revenue Cycle experienced. 

Probably the most difficult questions occurred during my interview with the Operations/IT Manager and Coding Director. The line of questioning presented by these individuals contained a high level of easily observable sarcastic replies, and inside jokes.  Additionally, there were no questions at all relating to how I would contribute to the role, nor any inquiry of my skills and experiences.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Detroit Medical Center (Detroit, MI) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email with instruction to contact HR for a phone interview.  The phone interviewer asked general questions I imagine to prescreen canidates that were mostly taken from my resume.  The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes.  I was then contacted via email for the second interview.  The second was face to face and lasted 2 hours.  Planning consisted of a review of the company, gathering references, list of accomplishments, copies of resume.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to revamp the entire fixed asset tracking system?
